item.title: Report E-2024110252
item.description:
Report E-2024110252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: ANDREWS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PETROLEUM TRANSPORTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver allowed CTMV to drift onto the right shoulder of the roadway. The driver over corrected to the left, which caused the CTMV to roll onto its right side. This caused about a 2 to 3 foot cut into the tank. Approximately 3,500 gallons of unleaded gasoline spilled onto the shoulder of the roadway. The Texas Department of Public Safety responded to the scene and notified United Petroleum Transports, Inc. UPT then contracted an Environmental Clean up Service. The Environmental Clean up Service went the scene and contained the spill. It the went through the process of removing the contaminated soil and replacing it with clean soil. The final remediation was done on 11/11/2024 and report was sent to TXDEQ. Fortunately, the spill occurred in an unpopulated area so no people, homes, or business were affected.

item.title: Report E-2024110219
item.description:
Report E-2024110219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: FREEPORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When they attempted delivery at the consignee the trailer started leaking from an 8 bolt flange where the primary discharge pipe meets the secondary discharge piping. After they shut down product flow and drained the piping the leak stopped. We got it back to our repair center and tightened the bolts 2 rotations which fixed the leak.

item.title: Report E-2024110197
item.description:
Report E-2024110197

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0735 ET, LGT notified ERTS of a 0.5-quart release of UN1133, Weld-All 8155 Purple Primer from a gallon container within a carton containing 6 containers due to improper loading from terminal LAB. The spill was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill and containerizing waste into a 55-gallon metal drum.
